Class Huffman

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tree
      • Huffman

  • public class Huffman
extends Tree
    A Huffman Code extension of the Tree class. Implements the Huffman encoding algorithm for variable-length encoding scheme (prefix-free).

    Uses a HashMap as a container collection to store the HuffmanNode objects for fast constant time access. The hashing function is a trivial one based on the conversion of the expected Character based key to ASCII integer.

    The building of the tree is accomplished using a PriorityQueue that bases its priority of the HuffmanNode objects based on the overriden Comparator interface method `compare`.

    See Also:
    Tree, HashMap, PriorityQueue

      • Fields inherited from class Tree

        root, size

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Huffman()
      Constructs a new Huffman with an empty `codeMap`.
      Huffman(java.lang.String textFileName)
      Constructs a new Huffman using the provided `textFileName` as name of the file to use to populate the `codeMap`, which is in turn used to build the priority queue, which is in turn used to build the tree itself.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Huffman

        public Huffman()
        Constructs a new Huffman with an empty `codeMap`.

      • Huffman

        public Huffman(java.lang.String textFileName)
        Constructs a new Huffman using the provided `textFileName` as name of the file to use to populate the `codeMap`, which is in turn used to build the priority queue, which is in turn used to build the tree itself. This is used to then build assign the codes to each leaf node of the tree and finally the `codeMap` is populated.
        Parameters:
        textFileName - the name of the text file

    • Method Detail

      • assignCodes

        public void assignCodes(HuffmanNode node,
                        java.lang.String code)
        Assigns the codes for each node in the tree based on its position respective to its parent.
        Parameters:
        node - the node representing tip of subtree investigated
        code - the code used to assign to HuffmanNode attribute

      • buildCodeMap

        public void buildCodeMap(HuffmanNode node)
        Populates the `codeMap` by traversing the tree and assigning the codes of each node inside a map.
        Parameters:
        node - the node representing tip of subtree being investigated

      • encode

        public java.lang.String encode(java.lang.String text)
        Encodes the given string using the Huffman encoding scheme built.
        Parameters:
        text - the text string wished to be encoded
        Returns:
        the string encoded

      • preOrderTraverse

        public void preOrderTraverse()
        Entry point wrapper for pre-order traversal printing of the tree.
        Overrides:
        preOrderTraverse in class Tree

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main class entry point. Prompts user to entry string and prints out the encoded string using the Huffman encoding sheme generated using the text file provided by name in command line argument. Example:

        `java Huffman [textFileName.txt]`

        `java Huffman Jabberwock.txt`

        Parameters:
        args - contains the file name string used to build tree
